noun.description: A narrow trench dug to mark out a boundary or to indicate lines of work in construction or civil engineering projects.

verb.description: To mark out (a line or boundary) by digging a lockspit or trench.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Exemplification St Ives Law Sewers. Apparently from either lock or lock + spit<br>late 17th century. From lockspit.
